holidays.name: Onion Rings Day
holidays.description: A delicious day dedicated to celebrating the crispy, golden, fried rings of onion that make every meal better!
holidays.origin: Popularized by American food culture as a fun food holiday, it’s a perfect excuse to indulge in this savory snack.
holidays.funFact: The largest onion ring ever made was over 54 inches in diameter and weighed more than 25 pounds!

holidays.name: National Chocolate Eclair Day
holidays.description: A sweet celebration honoring the iconic French pastry filled with cream and topped with chocolate glaze.
holidays.origin: Thought to have emerged from American obsessiveness with pastry days, celebrating this beloved treat's irresistible combination.
holidays.funFact: The word 'éclair' means 'lightning' in French, possibly because these pastries are eaten quickly or because their shiny glaze resembles lightning.

holidays.name: International Panic Day
holidays.description: A humorous observance dedicated to admitting panic and stress without shame, reminding us that sometimes it’s okay to freak out a little.
holidays.origin: Started on social media as a quirky reminder that everyone has panicky moments and it’s okay to let loose.
holidays.funFact: Though not an official holiday, people often share funny memes and tips to reset their calm on this day.

holidays.name: Hiking Day
holidays.description: A celebration encouraging people to explore nature, get some fresh air, and go for a hike in nearby parks or trails.
holidays.origin: Established by outdoor enthusiasts and nature lovers to promote physical health and mental well-being.
holidays.funFact: June 22 is perfect for hiking in many parts of the northern hemisphere because daylight hours are long and the summer scenery is in full bloom!
